data.Sentence_cn: 熟记台词
data.Sentence: --- lesson 22  By heart

data.Sentence_cn: 有些剧目十分成功，以致连续上演好几年。
data.Sentence: Some plays are so successful that they run for years on end.

data.Sentence_cn: 这样一来，可怜的演员们可倒霉了。因为他们需要一夜连着一夜地重复同样的台词。
data.Sentence: In many ways, this is unfortunate for the poor actors who are required to go on repeating the same lines night after night.

data.Sentence_cn: 人们以为，这些演员一定会把台词背得烂熟，绝不会临场结巴的，
data.Sentence: One would expect them to know their parts by heart and never have cause to falter.

data.Sentence_cn: 但情况却并不总是这样。
data.Sentence: Yet this is not always the case.

data.Sentence_cn: 有一位名演员曾在一出极为成功的剧目中扮演一个贵族角色，这个贵族已在巴士底狱被关押了20年。
data.Sentence: A famous actor in a highly successful play was once cast in the role of an aristocrat who had been imprisoned in the Bastille for twenty years.

data.Sentence_cn: 在最后一幕中，狱卒手持一封信上场，然后将信交给狱中那位贵族。
data.Sentence: In the last act, a gaoler would always come on to the stage with a letter which he would hand to the prisoner.

data.Sentence_cn: 尽管那个贵族每场戏都得念一遍那封信。
data.Sentence: Even though the noble was expected to read the letter at each performance,

data.Sentence_cn: 但他还是坚持要求将信的全文写在信纸上。
data.Sentence: he always insisted that it should be written out in full.

data.Sentence_cn: 一天晚上，狱卒决定与他的同事开一个玩笑，
data.Sentence: One night, the gaoler decided to play a joke on his colleague to find out if,

data.Sentence_cn: 看看他反复演出这么多场之后，是否已将信的内容记熟了。
data.Sentence: after so many performances, he had managed to learn the contents of the letter by heart.

data.Sentence_cn: 大幕拉开，最后一幕戏开演，贵族独自一人坐在铁窗后阴暗的牢房里。
data.Sentence: The curtain went up on the final act of the play and revealed the aristocrat sitting alone behind bars in his dark cell.

data.Sentence_cn: 这时狱卒上场，手里拿着那封珍贵的信。
data.Sentence: Just then, the gaoler appeared with the precious letter in his bands.

data.Sentence_cn: 狱卒走进牢房，将信交给贵族。
data.Sentence: He entered the cell and presented the letter to the aristocrat.

data.Sentence_cn: 但这回狱卒给贵族的信没有像往常那样把全文写全，
data.Sentence: But the copy he gave him had not been written out in full as usual.

data.Sentence_cn: 而是一张白纸。
data.Sentence: It was simply a blank sheet of paper.

data.Sentence_cn: 狱卒热切地观察着，急于想了解他的同事是否记熟了台词。
data.Sentence: The gaoler looked on eagerly, anxious to see if his fellow actor had at last learnt his lines.

data.Sentence_cn: 贵族盯着纸看了几秒钟，
data.Sentence: The noble stared at the blank sheet of paper for a few seconds.

data.Sentence_cn: 然后，眼珠一转，说道：“光线太暗，请给我读一下这封信。”
data.Sentence: Then, squinting his eyes, he said: 'The light is dim. Read the letter to me.'

data.Sentence_cn: 说完，他一下子把信递给狱卒。
data.Sentence: And he promptly handed the sheet of paper to the gaoler.

data.Sentence_cn: 狱卒发现自己连一个字也记不住，
data.Sentence: Finding that he could not remember a word of the letter either,

data.Sentence_cn: 于是便说：“陛下，这儿光线的确太暗了，我得去把眼镜拿来。”
data.Sentence: the gaoler replied: 'The light is indeed dim, sire. I must get my glasses.'

data.Sentence_cn: 他一边说着，一边匆匆下台。
data.Sentence: With this, he hurried off the stage.

data.Sentence_cn: 贵族感到非常好笑的是：
data.Sentence: Much to the aristocrat's amusement,

data.Sentence_cn: 一会儿工夫，狱卒重新登台，拿来一副眼镜以及平时使用的那封信，然后为那囚犯念了起来。
data.Sentence: the gaoler returned a few moments later with a pair of glasses and the usual copy of the letter which he proceeded to read to the prisoner.
